explanation: The clause allows the Disclosing Party to assign its rights freely (including to affiliates or successors) without obtaining the Receiving Party’s prior written consent, whereas the Receiving Party must obtain the Disclosing Party’s consent. The rule requires that neither party may assign without the other party’s prior written consent. Because the Disclosing Party is exempted from this requirement, the contract language is not compliant with the rule.
rule: Prohibit assignment of the NDA or rights under it by either party without the prior written consent of the other party.
exampleLanguage: Neither party may assign this Agreement or any rights or obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of the other party.
